solution_line_template: First find the number of nougats by doubling the number of caramels: {caramels} caramels * {nougat_multiplier} nougats/caramel = <<{caramels}*{nougat_multiplier}={nougats}>>{nougats} nougats
Then find the number of truffles by adding 7 to the number of caramels: {caramels} caramels + {truffle_addition} = <<{caramels}+{truffle_addition}={truffles}>>{truffles} truffles

Then find the number of peanut clusters by subtracting the number of each other chocolate from the total number of chocolates: {total_chocolates} chocolates - {caramels} caramels - {nougats} nougats - {truffles} truffles = <<{total_chocolates}-{caramels}-{nougats}-{truffles}={peanut_clusters}>>{peanut_clusters} peanut clusters

Finally, divide the number of peanut clusters by the total number of chocolates and multiply by {percentage_multiplier}% to find the percentage chance he gets a peanut cluster: {peanut_clusters} peanut clusters / {total_chocolates} chocolates *{percentage_multiplier}% = {percentage_chance}%
